00018 #include "MotionMatrix.h"
00019 #include "MeasurementMatrix.h"
00020 
00021 
00037 template<int V>
00038 void ShapeMatrix::solve(const MeasurementMatrix<V> &M, const MotionMatrix<V> &P) {
00039   double                        lambda; // projective depth
00040   double                        px, py;
00041   int                           i,j;
00042   int                           visiblePixels;
00043   Eigen::Matrix<double,2*V,3>   coeffs; // matrix for least squares solution
00044   Eigen::Matrix<double,2*V,1>   y;      // values for least squares solution
00045 
00046   resize(4,M.cols());
00047   row(3).setOnes();
00048   
00049   for(j = 0; j<cols(); ++j) {
00050     // --- Do linear least squares.
00051     // --- For each non-occluded pixel, pi, constraint is
00052     // --- l^-1(M.row(0:1) - pi.row(0:1)M.row(2))\chi
00053     // --- = -l^-1(T.row(0:1) - pi.row(0:1)*T.row(2))
00054     // --- Where P = [M|T] and X = [chi|1]^T
00055     // ---------------------------------------
00056     visiblePixels = 0;
00057     for(i=0; i<V; ++i) {
00058       if(!M.pixel_is_occluded(i,j)) {
00059         px = M.pixel(i,j)(0) / M.pixel(i,j)(2);
00060         py = M.pixel(i,j)(1) / M.pixel(i,j)(2);
00061         coeffs.row(2*i)   = P.M(i).row(0) - px * P.M(i).row(2); 
00062         coeffs.row(2*i+1) = P.M(i).row(1) - py * P.M(i).row(2);
00063         y(2*i)   = px * P.T(i)(2) - P.T(i)(0);
00064         y(2*i+1) = py * P.T(i)(2) - P.T(i)(1);
00065         ++visiblePixels;
00066       } else {
00067         coeffs.middleRows<2>(2*i).setZero();
00068         y.middleRows<2>(2*i).setZero();
00069       }
00070     }
00071     
00072 
00073     if(visiblePixels < 2) {
00074       // --- not enough pixels to constrain X
00075       // --- so just choose a null vector
00076       block<3,1>(0,j) =
00077         coeffs.jacobiSvd(Eigen::ComputeFullU | Eigen::ComputeFullV).solve(y);
00078       continue;
00079     }
00080 
00081     // --- first estimate lambda
00082     // --- and use to set weights
00083 
00084     block<3,1>(0,j) =
00085       (coeffs.transpose() * coeffs).ldlt().solve(coeffs.transpose()*y);
00086 
00087     //std::cout << "Approx X = " << col(j) << std::endl;
00088     //std::cout << "Error = " << std::endl << coeffs * block<3,1>(0,j) - y << std::endl;
00089 
00090     for(i=0; i<V; ++i) {
00091       lambda = P.view(i).row(2)*col(j);
00092       coeffs.middleRows<2>(2*i) /= lambda;
00093       y.middleRows<2>(2*i)      /= lambda;
00094     }
00095 
00096     // --- now re-solve with weights
00097     /****
00098     block<3,1>(0,j) = 
00099       coeffs.jacobiSvd(Eigen::ComputeFullU | Eigen::ComputeFullV).solve(y);
00100     ****/
00101     block<3,1>(0,j) =
00102       (coeffs.transpose() * coeffs).ldlt().solve(coeffs.transpose()*y);
00103 
00104     //std::cout << "Min X = " << col(j) << std::endl;
00105     //std::cout << "Shape/Motion error = " << std::endl << coeffs * block<3,1>(0,j) - y << std::endl;
00106   }
00107   //std::cout << "Reconstruction = " << std::endl;
00108   //std::cout << P*(*this) << std::endl;
00109   //std::cout << "Measurement = " << std::endl;
00110   //std::cout << M << std::endl;
00111 }

00116 template<class D>
00117 ShapeMatrix &ShapeMatrix::operator =(const Eigen::MatrixBase<D> &o) {
00118   Eigen::Matrix4Xd::operator =(o);
00119   return(*this);
00120 }
